<h1>
<a id="user-content-ggplot2bdc" class="anchor" href="#ggplot2bdc" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>ggplot2bdc</h1>

<p>ggplot2bdc is a collection of themes and other things that can be used when
creating plots with <a href="http://ggplot2.org/">ggplot2</a>.</p>

<h1>
<a id="user-content-installation" class="anchor" href="#installation" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Installation</h1>

<p><code>ggplot2bdc</code> is not on <a href="http://cran.r-project.org/">CRAN</a>, but you can use
<a href="http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/devtools/index.html">devtools</a> to
install the latest and greatest version. To do so:</p>

<pre><code>if(!require('devtools')) install.packages('devtools')
library(devtools)
install_github('briandconnelly/ggplot2bdc')
</code></pre>

<h1>
<a id="user-content-examples" class="anchor" href="#examples" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Examples</h1>

<p>To gain access to the following themes, etc. provided, first load the
<code>gplot2bdc</code> package. We'll also load <code>ggplot</code>.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-smi">ggplot2bdc</span>)
library(<span class="pl-smi">ggplot2</span>)</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-theme_bdc_simplefacets" class="anchor" href="#theme_bdc_simplefacets" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>theme_bdc_simplefacets</h2>

<p><code>theme_bdc_simplefacets</code> is a clean theme that uses thin black panels on a white
background. Legends are placed above. Facet labels are displayed as black text.
Subtle grid lines can be added to the panels with the <code>grid.x</code> and <code>grid.y</code>
parameters.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">year</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">1000000</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    facet_grid(<span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span> <span class="pl-k">~</span> .) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Year<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Hollywood Budgets Against Time<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_simplefacets(<span class="pl-v">grid.y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>, <span class="pl-v">grid.x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>)</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-theme_bdc_grey" class="anchor" href="#theme_bdc_grey" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>theme_bdc_grey</h2>

<p><code>theme_bdc_grey</code> is a clean theme that uses thin grey panels on a white
background. Legends are placed above. Facet labels are displayed as black text
on a grey background.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">year</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">1000000</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    facet_grid(<span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span> <span class="pl-k">~</span> .) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Year<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Hollywood Budgets Against Time<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_grey()</pre></div>

<p>Subtle grid lines can be added to the panels with the <code>grid.x</code> and <code>grid.y</code>
parameters:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">year</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">1000000</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    facet_grid(<span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span> <span class="pl-k">~</span> .) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Year<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Hollywood Budgets Against Time<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_grey(<span class="pl-v">grid.x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>, <span class="pl-v">grid.y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)</pre></div>

<p>Some people prefer to display categorical data without tick marks along the
axis. These are included by default, but can be removed by setting either the
<code>ticks.x</code> or <code>ticks.y</code> parameters to <code>FALSE</code>.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">msleep</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">vore</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">sleep_total</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point(<span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>, <span class="pl-v">alpha</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0.2</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    stat_summary(<span class="pl-v">fun.data</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>mean_cl_boot<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_grey(<span class="pl-v">ticks.x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>)</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-theme_bdc_black" class="anchor" href="#theme_bdc_black" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>theme_bdc_black</h2>

<p><code>theme_bdc_black</code> is a clean theme that uses thin black panels on a white
background. Legends are placed above. Facet labels are displayed as black text
on a grey background. Subtle grid lines can be added to the panels with the
<code>grid.x</code> and <code>grid.y</code> parameters, and tick markscan be managed with <code>ticks.x</code>
and <code>ticks.y</code>.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">year</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">1000000</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    facet_grid(<span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span> <span class="pl-k">~</span> .) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Year<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Hollywood Budgets Against Time<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_black(<span class="pl-v">grid.y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>, <span class="pl-v">grid.x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>)</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-theme_bdc_paneled" class="anchor" href="#theme_bdc_paneled" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>theme_bdc_paneled</h2>

<p><code>theme_bdc_paneled</code> is a clean theme that displays plots without borders on grey
panels. Legends are placed above. Facet labels are displayed as plan black text.
Subtle grid lines can be added to the panels with the <code>grid.x</code> and <code>grid.y</code>
parameters, and tick markscan be managed with <code>ticks.x</code> and <code>ticks.y</code>. By
default, grid lines are used along the Y axis. This theme is best suited for
plots with multiple facets.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">year</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">1000000</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    facet_grid(<span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span> <span class="pl-k">~</span> .) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Year<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Hollywood Budgets Against Time<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_paneled()</pre></div>

<p>To more clearly distinguish the individual panels, thick lines can be added on
the far right of each panel. For example:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">year</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">1000000</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    facet_grid(<span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span> <span class="pl-k">~</span> .) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Year<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Hollywood Budgets Against Time<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_vline(aes(<span class="pl-v">xintercept</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">Inf</span>), <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>grey40<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">size</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">3</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_paneled()</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-theme_bdc_simple" class="anchor" href="#theme_bdc_simple" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>theme_bdc_simple</h2>

<p><code>theme_bdc_simple</code> is a classic theme that displays plot axes as solid black
lines on a white background. This theme is probably best suited to single-panel
plots.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">year</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">length</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>, <span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Year<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Length (Minutes)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Movie Lengths Against Time<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    scale_y_log10() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_simple()</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-theme_bdc_microtiter" class="anchor" href="#theme_bdc_microtiter" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>theme_bdc_microtiter</h2>

<p><code>theme_bdc_microtiter</code> is a specialized theme for use in creating figures that
represent 96-well microtiter plates.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-smi">dplyr</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">platemap</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> read.csv(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>~/Dropbox/Research/Documents/Blog/Blog Post-Analyzing Bacterial Growth/data/platemap.csv<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-smi">platemap</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> mutate(<span class="pl-smi">platemap</span>, <span class="pl-v">Row</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>as.numeric(match(toupper(substr(<span class="pl-smi">Well</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)), <span class="pl-c1">LETTERS</span>)), <span class="pl-v">Column</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>as.numeric(substr(<span class="pl-smi">Well</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>,<span class="pl-c1">5</span>)))
<span class="pl-smi">platemap</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Environment</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> as.factor(<span class="pl-smi">platemap</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">Environment</span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-v">data</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">platemap</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">Column</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">Row</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point(<span class="pl-v">data</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>expand.grid(seq(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">12</span>), seq(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">8</span>)), aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">Var1</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">Var2</span>), <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>grey90<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">fill</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>white<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">21</span>, <span class="pl-v">size</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point(aes(<span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">Environment</span>, <span class="pl-v">colour</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">Strain</span>), <span class="pl-v">size</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    coord_fixed(<span class="pl-v">ratio</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>(<span class="pl-c1">13</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">12</span>)<span class="pl-k">/</span>(<span class="pl-c1">9</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">8</span>), <span class="pl-v">xlim</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>,<span class="pl-c1">12.5</span>), <span class="pl-v">ylim</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>,<span class="pl-c1">8.5</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    scale_y_reverse(<span class="pl-v">breaks</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>seq(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">8</span>), <span class="pl-v">labels</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">LETTERS</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">8</span>]) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    scale_x_continuous(<span class="pl-v">breaks</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>seq(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">12</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Plate Layout for My Experiment<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_microtiter()</pre></div>

<p>For more information, see the <a href="http://bconnelly.net/2014/05/plotting-microtiter-plate-maps/">Plotting Microtiter Plate Maps</a>.</p>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-theme_bdc_lattice_population" class="anchor" href="#theme_bdc_lattice_population" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>theme_bdc_lattice_population</h2>

<p><code>theme_bdc_lattice_population</code> is a specialized theme intended to display
populations of individuals structured spatially in a lattice.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">popdata</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> read.csv(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>sample_population_data.csv<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)
head(<span class="pl-smi">popdata</span>)

ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">popdata</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">Column</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">Row</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">Genotype</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
        geom_point(<span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">15</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
        coord_equal(<span class="pl-v">ratio</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
        scale_color_hue(<span class="pl-v">guide</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
        theme_bdc_lattice_population()</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-rescale_golden" class="anchor" href="#rescale_golden" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>rescale_golden</h2>

<p><code>rescale_golden</code> adjusts the proportions of the axes of the given plot object
so that follow the golden ratio (horizontally). If no plot is provided, the last
plot that was displayed is used.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">mtcars</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">hp</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">mpg</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_smooth() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point(<span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Horsepower<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Fuel Efficiency (mpg)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_grey()</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>rescale_golden()</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-rescale_square" class="anchor" href="#rescale_square" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>rescale_square</h2>

<p><code>rescale_square</code> adjusts the proportions of the axes of the given plot object
so that they are equal. If no plot is provided, the last plot that was displayed
is used.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-smi">dplyr</span>)

<span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> filter(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, <span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span><span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>PG<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)

ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_smooth() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point(<span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Rating<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Does Budget Affect Movie Ratings?<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_grey()</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>rescale_square()</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-rescale_plot" class="anchor" href="#rescale_plot" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>rescale_plot</h2>

<p><code>rescale_plot</code> adjusts the proportions of the axes of the given plot object to
the given ratio. If no plot is provided, the last plot that was displayed is
used.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-smi">dplyr</span>)

<span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> filter(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, <span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span><span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>PG<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)

ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_smooth() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point(<span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Rating<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Does Budget Affect Movie Ratings?<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_grey()
rescale_plot(<span class="pl-v">ratio</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">16</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">9</span>)</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-coord_golden" class="anchor" href="#coord_golden" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>coord_golden</h2>

<p><code>coord_golden</code> sets the aspect ratio of the axes according to the golden ratio.
Whether the panel follows the golden ratio horizontally or vertically can be set
using the <code>orientation</code> argument. For an introduction to how aspect ratio
affects perception, see
<a href="http://eagereyes.org/basics/banking-45-degrees">Aspect Ratio and Banking to 45 Degrees</a>.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-smi">dplyr</span>)

<span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> filter(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, <span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span><span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>PG<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)

ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">year</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>, <span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Year<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>PG-13 Movie Budgets<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_grey() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    coord_golden(<span class="pl-v">xvals</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">year</span>, <span class="pl-v">yvals</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>,
                 <span class="pl-v">orientation</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>horizontal<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-coord_square" class="anchor" href="#coord_square" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>coord_square</h2>

<p><code>coord_square</code> sets the aspect ratio of the axes according to a square.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-smi">dplyr</span>)

<span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> filter(<span class="pl-smi">movies</span>, <span class="pl-smi">mpaa</span><span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>PG<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)

ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_smooth() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point(<span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Budget ($ Millions)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Rating<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Does Budget Affect Movie Ratings?<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_grey() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    coord_square(<span class="pl-v">xvals</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">pg_movies</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">budget</span><span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>, <span class="pl-v">yvals</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">movies</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">rating</span>)</pre></div>

<h2>
<a id="user-content-ggsave_golden" class="anchor" href="#ggsave_golden" aria-hidden="true"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>ggsave_golden</h2>

<p><code>ggsave_golden</code> saves the given plot to the given filename. If no plot is
specified, the most recently displayed plot is used. The proportions of the
plot's axes should first be set to the golden ratio using <code>rescale_golden</code> or
<code>coord_golden</code>.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">mtcars</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">hp</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">mpg</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_smooth() <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    geom_point(<span class="pl-v">shape</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Horsepower<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Fuel Efficiency (mpg)<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
    theme_bdc_grey()
rescale_golden()
ggsave_golden(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>mpg against horsepower.pdf<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)</pre></div>
